div.l: Ill haille bi god Aleyn thou is a fonne
These seli clerkis han full faste ronne
Towarde the fen bothen Aleyn ⁊and ek Iohn
And whan the Miller sigh that thei were gon
He half a buschell of here flour hath take
And bad his wif go knede it in a cake
And seide I trowe the clerkis weren a ferde
Yet kan a Miller make a clerkis berde
For all his arte yet late hem gon here weie
Lo where þei goon ye lat the children pleie
Thei gete hym nought so lightly be my crowne
These seli clerkis rennen vp ⁊and downe
With kepe · kepe · stand · stand · iossa warderere
Ga whistill thou ⁊and I sall kepe hym here
But schortly till it was v̉errey nyght
Thei couthe nought thouȝ thei dide all her myght
Her caple cacche he ran alweie so faste
Till in a diche thei caught hym atte laste
Wery ⁊and wete as beest is in the rayn
Comth seli Iohn ⁊and with hym comth Alayn
¶ Allas ꝙquod Iohn the day that I was born
Now are we dryuen till hethyng ⁊and till scorn
Our corn is stole men woll vs foles calle
Bothe the wardeyn ⁊and our felawes alle
And namely the Miller weilawaye
Thus pleyneth Iohn as he goth bi the waye
Towarde the Mille ⁊and bayarde in his honde
The Miller sittyng bi the fire he fonde
For it was nyght ⁊and ferther myght þei nought
But for the loue of god thei hym bisought
Of herberwe ⁊and of ese as for here peny
¶ The Miller seide a geyn if ther be eny
Suche as it is yet schall ye haue yoʳur part
Mi hous is streit but ye han lerned art
Ye can bi argument make a place
A myle brood of twenti foot of space
Lat se now if this place mow suffise
Or make it rowm̉er with speche as is yoʳur gise
¶ Now Symond seide this Iohn be seynt Cutberd
Ay is thou mery ⁊and that is faire answerd
I haue herd saie men sall taken of twa thyngis
Swilk as he fynt or take swilk as he bryngis
But specially I praie the oost dere
Gete vs som mete ⁊and drynke ⁊and make vs cheere
And we woll payen trewely atte fulle
With empti hondis men may noon haukes hukeshaukes tulle
Lo here our siluer redy for till spende
